Things are finally looking up for Swansea. Theyâ€™ve moved past the controversial firing of Bob Bradley, and new manager Paul Clement just got his first big result, beating title challengers Liverpool 3-2 in their last Premier League match.

The dab refuses to die. It lasted all of 2016 (which makes it one of the hardiest things still in existence), and itâ€™s clearly still going strong in 2017. 
Coach Gibbs crushes it, though. The dap, the dab, the pure commitment to it all. It already looks like heâ€™s got a good rapport with his players, and as cliched as it sounds, that can make all the difference in a season where the smallest margins can be the difference between relegation and safety. 
So, there we have it. The dab is going to save Swansea. You heard it here first.
